questions.question: The creation accounts in Genesis tell us:

choices.answer: God made the world with perfect order
God made the world to be complex and beautiful

questions.question: When Adam and Eve listened to the snake, they gave into the temptation to:
Finish this sentence: After Adam and Eve sinned against God...

choices.answer: sin has been a personal problem for all humans, everywhere.
sin has been a nuisance, but not a big deal.
sin has had no consequence on the world.
sin proved to be good for people, not bad.

questions.question: By the time of Noah, the world had become very evil. How does the Bible describe this?

choices.answer: The Lord was happy he had made human beings on the earth
The Lord didn't care about the human beings on the earth
The Lord was frustrated with the human beings on the earth
The Lord regretted he had made human beings on the earth

questions.question: Although God destroyed the earth with the flood, he planned to start his creating work again by

choices.answer: making sure the floodwater was drinkable
saving Noah's family and the animals
planning things better the second time
creating Batman as a back-up plan

questions.question: Although Noah was a God-fearing man, he couldn't save the world from sin because...

choices.answer: He was busy looking after all the animals
He was burnt out after building the ark
He had a sin problem of his own

questions.question: God himself had to save people from sin, so he began his rescue plan with which promises to A?

choices.answer: Egyptian cotton bedsheets, a new pool, and an ipad

questions.question: God kept his promises to Abraham in both smaller ways and big ways. How did he keep the former?

choices.answer: A's family grew into a nation, with land + God was with them
A's family got good christmas presents
A's friends were always good to him

questions.question: Abraham had a son called...
Isaac had a son called...
It looked like God had not kept his promises to Abraham when...

choices.answer: Joseph, Jacob's son gets sold into slavery in Egypt
Jacob's family experiences famine and go to Egypt for food
Jacob and all his kids get stuck in Egypt as slaves

questions.question: But there were signs that God would keep his promises when...

choices.answer: Jacob + his sons, grew in number though they were slaves
God appeared to Moses and told him to rescue his people
God allowed Moses to be raised in Pharaoh's palace

questions.question: God led his people out of Egypt by...

choices.answer: Sending plagues to show Pharoah he was not God
Making his people ready to go

questions.question: God showed his people that it was HIM who saved his people by

choices.answer: Miraculously parting the Red Sea for them to walk through
Giving the Egyptians gastro the night before
Making them vanish out of Pharoah's sight
Sending a strong wind to blow the Egyptians over

questions.question: While the Israelites were waiting to enter the land, God gave them instructions on how to:
God raised up who to lead his people into the promised land?
When they got into the land, the Israelites rejected God again. How did they do this?
This was offensive to God because...

choices.answer: he already had a plan to give them a human king.
he was sick them asking for things.
he was their king and they didn't need another.
he needed some space from his people

questions.question: God taught his people a lesson by giving them a king who sucked. His name was...
The second king was David and he was a good King. What promise did God make to David?

choices.answer: That he would never get sick
That someone from his family would always an eternal king
That he would never be hungry
That he would live to be an old man

questions.question: After David, most of Israel's kings were bad and led God's people away from him, so God...

choices.answer: sent prophets to warn his people to stop sinning
sent prophets to tell his people God would not abandon them
sent prophets to warn his people that judgment would come

questions.question: God's people didn't listen, so he allowed which nation 2 invade and destroy 10 of their tribes?
2 tribes were given extra time to repent but they didn't. To which country were they exiled?
Name the small number of people who stayed faithful to God, despite being captives in Babylon.
God never gave up on his people, and eventually the remnant came back to Israel's capital named
The remnant lived in Jerusalem and faithfully waited for God to keep his promises to do what?

choices.answer: Give them land, kids and blessing
Be with them again like in the tabernacle
Send them a rescuer called the Messiah

questions.question: John's gospel describes Jesus as Immanuel which means what?
Because Jesus died and rose again to deal with sin problems, he takes us 2 the real land called
Because Jesus died and rose again to deal with our sin problem, other Christians are now God's
Because Jesus died and rose again to deal with our sin problem, Christians are blessed cause...

choices.answer: they have had their sin problem forgiven
